Detailed Description

The IVR Interface.

IVR

The interactive voice response (IVR) is the pre-recorded or the dynamically generated audio for system information such as IP, default gateway and phone number. On the other hand user can configure the system by passing the special combination of keys.
This function is very useful when web interface malfunctions.

Function Documentation

unsigned int  sid,

char *  pszText2Speech

Play a text speech.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
sidThe session number.
dirThe playout directions.
pszText2SpeechThe text to speech.
Return values
Playinginterval in Unit of 10ms.
Examples:
fxo.c, fxs.c, and ivr_text_play.c.

Parameters

sidThe session number.
dirThe playout directions.
nFrameCountThe number of frame to be decoded.

Return values
Copiedframes, so less or equal to nFrameCount.
